com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface createOrderInvoice

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface createOrderInvoice

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createOrderInvoice(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The createOrderInvoice API can be run to create invoices for an order.

    • Method Detail

      • createOrderInvoice

        org.w3c.dom.Document createOrderInvoice(YFSEnvironment env,
                                        org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                 throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                        java.rmi.RemoteException
        The createOrderInvoice API can be run to create invoices for an order. This API can also be configured as an agent.

        When invoicing return orders, the amount of the invoice is returned to the originating sales order(s), unless it is a return without a sales order or a return by a gift recipient, in which case the amount is debited to the return order. The return occurs by creating a charge transaction against the appropriate order (sales or return), with ChargeType = RETURN and DebitAmount = the amount invoiced.

        However, regardless of if the invoice is against the sales or return order, if the return order has a confirmed exchange order created for it, the funds as required by the exchange order will be transferred to the exchange order. Only the remaining amount after the transfer will be returned to the sales order(s) or return order. For example, a return order for $100 is being partially invoiced for $10, and it has an exchange order created for it valued at $70. The full amount of the invoice, $10, will be transferred for use in the exchange order. Next, the remaining lines on the return order are invoiced for $90. Only $60 will be transferred for use in the exchange order and the remaining $30 will be returned to the originating sales order.

        When transferring funds to the exchange order, a TRANSFER_OUT charge transaction will be created for the order which the invoice is against (sales/return), with credit amount = negative refund amount and a TRANSFER_IN charge transaction will be created for the exchange order with credit amount = refund amount.

        When invoicing a return order, which is for a sales order, repricing on the sales order may take place based on the return reason for the return order line. If repricing is required for the return reason, quantity that is getting invoiced is reduced from RepricingQuantity. This triggers the repricing logic on sales order. Price on sales order will be recomputed based on orderReprice user exit. Adjustment invoice will get created for the price change based on the rule Apply Price Change To Invoiced Quantity.

        When the flag IgnoreStatusCheck is passed as "Y" in the input, this API expects OrderLine element in the input. An invoice will be created for the quantity passed on all OrderLine elements regardless of what status each line quantity is in. Status of the order lines will not be changed in this mode. When this API is called as a transaction in the pipeline, it will invoice all quantity that is not already invoiced on the order and change its status to one of the drop statuses of the transaction and raise the ON_INVOICE_CREATION event. This will also move the quantity already invoiced on the order to one of the drop statuses and not raise the ON_INVOICE_CREATION event for that quantity.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetHeaderChargesForShipmentUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.OMPGetInvoiceNoUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetLineChargesForShipmentUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSRecalculateHeaderTaxUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSRecalculateLineTaxUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSConvertCurrencyUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSDetermineDateForPricingUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetInvoicePricingQtyUE

          This user exit is called to override the quantity to be considered for invoicing.

        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSOrderRepricingUE

        Events Raised:

        CREATE_ORDER_INVOICE.ON_INVOICE_CREATION


          Key data - order_dbd.txt
          Data published - YFS_CREATE_ORDER_INVOICE.ON_INVOICE_CREATION.html
          Template Support - Yes
          Configuration Required for Backward Compatability - No

        Audits:
        A YFS_ORDER_STATUS_AUDIT record is written indicating the from and to status change of the order.

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatability: No

        Additional Information:
        The output template for this API cannot be made document specific.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document containing the list of created invoices. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
